column4: What's the Ubuntu equivalent to chkconfig --list on redhat based stuff?
and what does chkconfig --list do?
So chkconfig postfix on sets postfix to start at boot, chkconfig postfix off disables it at boot, and --list shows what services start at particular runlevels.
aah. sorry, not sure of the equivalent
No worries.  Thanks anyway. :)
seems the package exists on debian though, so it should be the same in ubuntu
http://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=chkconfig
it'd be your basic sudo apt-get install chkconfig
Was hoping not to install it; it feels like cheating to turn Ubuntu into RedHat. :-p
lol. fair enough
The /topic there gives great pointers.
i've been a few times, but i wouldn't say go to an irc chat to LEARN a langauge. maybe for getting help, sure. or if you already know a bit /topic is fine
of ourse, this is just MHO
Heh, the topic there includes a link to said tutorial. :)
touche. never bothered clicking on it, considering i just recently got hyperlinks working in terminals
Copy/paste works wonders though. :)
i also just recently learned how to copy/paste from a terminal ;-) (shift+insert)
using urxvt, so no gui right-clicking here
ITYM ctrl alt backspace?
youre right. duno why i forgot to add the alt
most of my bindings use alt, so i just forget it
heck, you're talking to a guy that swapped his caps lock and ctrl keys ;-)
